file_content.text: I am here. Let the war begin.
Yes, time is of the essence. Lieutenant Pierce, Captain Quinn, bring my apprentice up to speed on our enemy's activity.
Yes, my lord. It's a fairly complex situation....
General Faraire, the War Trust's most senior member, is garrisoned in a fortified wing of the Republic's main base.
He's got a huge army protecting him, more reinforcements on the way. We're outnumbered eight-to-one.
My lord, the lieutenant's statistics are inexact, but the general thrust is sound. The numbers favor Faraire, but there are ways around that.
If you have a plan, let's hear it.
I'm all ears.
Stick close to the captain, Lieutenant; you might learn a thing or two.
Listen to Quinn, Pierce.
Noted.
Does Lieutenant Pierce rub you the wrong way, Quinn?
You sound perturbed.
I'm sure it's just a product of his enthusiasm.
Now, to maximize our chances, we must coordinate three simultaneous strikes. One will destroy the base's power station....
Another will sabotage its spaceport force field to thwart any reinforcements, and the last will force the conscripted regiments of Faraire's army to flee.
It's straightforward then.
What do these strikes entail?
Give me the details.
The details will be forthcoming, apprentice, but I do not need to hear them.
That's a lot to deal with.
War is never simple, apprentice.
Quinn will coordinate from the base, and you will lead the front line offensive. Beyond that, decide how to assign your men. Goodbye.
I'm the best choice for front line work. You need a soldier.
I disagree. If the frontal assault isn't handled correctly, your route into the command center will be clogged with run-over battlefield soldiers.
In my opinion, Jaesa should join you. She can use her power to see into the hearts of the enemy and identify the insecure ranks.
I want Jaesa's insights on the battlefield.
Jaesa will go.
Suit up, Lieutenant. I want to see you in action firsthand.
Pierce will go.
I want Vette to learn more combat skills. She comes.
Vette will go.
Whatever you wish, my lord.
That leaves Pierce and Jaesa for the power station demolition and spaceport sabotage.
That leaves Vette and Jaesa for the power station demolition and spaceport sabotage.
If the traps and mines that protect the power station aren't circumvented in time, you'll be under constant turret fire inside the Republic base.
Vette, clear the way so the power station can be destroyed.
Vette is best suited for that.
Child's play.
Unless Jaesa is able to lock the spaceport force field, Faraire's reinforcements will arrive in time to fight you inside the base.
Jaesa, take out that power station.
Jaesa will handle that.
I'll do what I can, master.
I will do my best, my lord.
Unless Pierce can lock the spaceport force field in time, you'll face Faraire's reinforcements inside the base.
Don't worry about me, Captain.
Lieutenant, take out that power station.
Pierce will handle that.
Done.
Unless Jaesa and Moff Hurdenn's technicians can lock the spaceport force field in time, you'll face Faraire's reinforcements inside the base.
I'm not wild about being sent to tinker, but I'll give it my best, master.
I will try to figure out the Republic's systems swiftly, my lord.
Unless Vette and Moff Hurdenn's technicians can lock the spaceport force field in time, you'll face Faraire's reinforcements inside the base.
Not exactly my forte, but I'll do the best I can.
Pierce, since I denied you your preference, choose which of these assaults you want.
Let the lieutenant pick.
I know how the Republic systems work. I can sabotage their spaceport.
And I can dismantle the traps and mines at the power station with my eyes closed. But, uh, I'll keep one open anyway.
I guess that leaves the power station for me. Not the excitement I was hoping for, but I'll do my best.
And I'll do everything I can to knock out that power station.
Unless Pierce locks the spaceport force field, Faraire's reinforcements will arrive in time to fight you inside the base.
Won't be an issue.
In your opinion, who is better suited for this assault?
Who do you suggest, Quinn?
With help form Moff Hurdenn's technicians, Jaesa may be able to sabotage the spaceport force field in time.
But with Vette's background in breaking and entering, she should make quick work of the power station traps.
Vette, destroy that power station; Jaesa, sabotage the spaceport.
I wholeheartedly agree.
I want Vette to sabotage the spaceport and Jaesa to destroy the power station.
I disagree.
If that makes sense to you, assign them as you see fit.
I don't care.
In that case, yes, Vette, you will destroy the power station. Jaesa, do the best you can to sabotage that force field.
Doesn't excite me, but I'll do my best.
I'll be as swift as I can be.
Yeah, I'll try to figure that out.
Mines and traps are like kid toys to me. No problem.
Assaults have been assigned, my lord. Once you've cleared the way on the front, invade General Faraire's command center at will.
Let's get this war started! My lord, any final words for the troops?
If you value your lives, do not fail me. The consequences will be dire.
Succeed or else.
Motivational.
Today, we fight as one. I believe in every one of you. Join me in victory!
Together, we triumph.
If that doesn't inspire, nothing will.
I'm about action, not speeches.
They don't need a pep talk.
Brilliant.
Good luck, my lord. I'll be coordinating the attacks via holo.
Don't worry, Captain. The real soldiers have got this one.
My lord, I am preparing for my assault on Taris.
Excellent. Your mission on Taris is to take down the Republic's entire Strategic High Command.
The War Trust--the four generals who implement the bulk of the Republic military force's strategic planning--are all on Taris as we speak.
Normally they're never together in one place. This is an incredible opportunity.
The Republic will pay for such a blunder.
I shall seize it.
It won't be easy. The War Trust generals are master strategists.
It must be something very important for them to expose themselves like this.
What could they be up to?
Truthfully, I don't care about their agenda--the War Trust generals themselves are the true threat.
Tell me about these generals.
Who are they?
The War Trust has stretched the Republic's resources and fought us to a standstill time and again. They are master strategists.
Generals Faraire, Minst, Durant and Frellka should not be taken lightly.
Each will likely be protected by his own elite guard, and they have all the Republic forces on Taris at their disposal.
I'll defeat all our enemies.
If the War Trust can be killed, that is in effect what will be achieved.
Bad news.
This will likely be the largest scale assault you have ever undertaken.
Sounds thrilling.
Do not approach this endeavor frivolously, apprentice. Your task on Taris represents the largest scale assault of your career.
Moff Hurdenn leads the Imperial forces on the planet. He will provide whatever resources he can.
Shuttle to the surface and seek him out, immediately.
Why have you gone to Taris? I specifically directed you to stop the siege of Darth Vengean's flagship and kill Admiral Monk.
Monk is the most elusive of your targets. This is our chance to destroy him.
Handle the conflict in space first, apprentice. That is an order.
Excellent. Now that Admiral Monk and the Jedi have been neutralized, the Republic's Strategic High Command is all that remains.
In that case, yes, Vette, you will destroy the power station. Broonmark, do the best you can to sabotage that force field.
We are ready! We are unleashed!
Unless Broonmark and Moff Hurdenn's technicians can lock the spaceport force field in time, you'll face Faraire's reinforcements inside the base.
We break anything. We are ready!
With help from Moff Hurdenn's technicians, Broonmark may be able to sabotage the spaceport force field in time.
In my opinion, Broonmark should join you. If you are able to identify the conscripted regiments, he can strike the most fear into them.
The lieutenant is savvy enough to identify the conscripts, and the Talz will do the intimidating.
Pierce and Broonmark will go.
I want the benefit of Jaesa's insights, and Vette needs to work on intimidation.
Jaesa and Vette will go.
The Talz is best suited to terrorize the enemy.
Broonmark will go.
Jaesa and Broonmark should join you. Jaesa can see into the hearts of the enemy and identify the insecure ranks, and Broonmark will be best at intimidating them into running.
Quinn's right. I want the benefit of Jaesa's insights, and the Talz can terrorize like no other.
Jaesa and Broonmark will go.
That leaves Pierce and Broonmark for the power station demolition and spaceport sabotage.
That leaves Vette and Broonmark for the power station demolition and spaceport sabotage.
My lord, with you overseeing the frontal assault, that leaves Pierce and Vette to handle the power station demolition and spaceport sabotage.
I want Vette to sabotage the spaceport and Broonmark to destroy the power station.
I disagree.
Vette, destroy that power station; Broonmark, sabotage the spaceport.
I wholeheartedly agree.
Then we are ready for war. Ready to destroy the enemy's power now!
Broonmark, clear the way so the power station can be destroyed.
I choose Broonmark
We are ready, clan leader.
That leaves Pierce and Vette to handle the power station demolition and the spaceport sabotage.
Very good, my lord.
